item.title: My 440 Option Interface
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“dutchboy, post:16, topic:296444”]telling me i cant spell doesnt really help wich make ur post spam, and as i already said i set it under aclass44 = aclass44

now can anyone help me with this problem?
and you dont need to say oh em gee it doesnt work? what cud be the problem.[/quote]
It doesnt even go under aclass44, if you even read, besides accusing me of spamming, it simply says:

CoonHunter:

Ok first of all, “putted”??? Sounds like a golf word to me. As for the “addText” thing, if you looked at how his client is coded, it has a special spot for those addText parts. So most likely its not gonna work for you.

Read full topic

item.title: My 440 Option Interface
item.dc:creator: @2012_Ben 2012 || Ben
item.description:
@2012_Ben wrote:

[quote=“Primadude, post:8, topic:296444”][quote author=2012 || Ben link=topic=392447.msg2922038#msg2922038 date=1250812233]

You should use my way of handling interfaces that is in my client :); it’s a lot tidier.

There’s no need.
[/quote]

So you’d rather stack every interface into the Class9 class, like your average server-sided ‘Client’ class, than handle each interface in a separate class using an Interface class to branch them and make it a lot easier?[/quote]

Well yea, because it takes longer to load the class packaged.

And I’ve heard you removed NPC facing on your iClarity source. In the video of fightcaves the npcs face you, but in the download one they don’t.

Can you please help me, I’ve tried different ways of doing it but it just doesn’t want to work.

And if you havn’t, where’s the original place where you added NPC facing player?

Read full topic
